title: 111_s189
content: The Act titled "National Trails System Willing Seller Act" authorizes the acquisition of land from willing sellers for certain trails. The National Trails System Willing Seller Act authorizes the Federal Government to acquire land for specific historic trails with the consent of the owner, limited to a quarter-mile on either side of the trail. The Federal Government can acquire land for specific historic trails with the owner's consent, limited to a quarter-mile on either side of the trail. The National Trails System Act is amended to require the Federal Government to obtain the landowner's consent before acquiring land outside federally administered areas for specific trails, limited to a quarter-mile on each side of the trail. The Federal Government must obtain landowner consent before acquiring land outside federally administered areas for specific trails, limited to a quarter-mile on each side of the trail. The Federal Government requires landowner consent to acquire land outside federally administered areas for specific trails. The Federal Government can only acquire land for trails outside federally administered areas with the landowner's consent, limited to an average of 1/4 mile on either side of the trail. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENT. Section 10 of the National Trails System Act is amended to authorize appropriations for the Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail, with specific limits on funding for land acquisition. The Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail may receive up to $2,000,000 for development, with encouragement for volunteer trail groups to participate.
